questions.question: What subjects are included in the school's curriculum?
questions.answer: It depends on which class you are talking about but the overall subjects are, science, hindi, sanskrit, sst and maths

questions.question: Are there any foreign language courses offered as part of the curriculum?
questions.answer: Yes, there is moral science but there are also paid clubs for the kinds from 5th to 8th class.

questions.question: What is the school's policy on homework and is it related to cbse?
questions.answer: The school tries to minimise the homework given to children and at the same time ensure that they are not deprived of enough knowledge, also we give all the activities provided to us by CBSE to make the subject more interactive.

questions.question: Are there any opportunities for students to pursue independent projects or research within the curriculum?
questions.answer: Yes, we provide student with a lot of tools and an ATL lab to help them int here project, and if the student wants to participate in any competitions they are free to do so, and we also provide students with monthly olympiads

questions.question: Can student wear anything other then the uniform?
questions.answer: We are very strict about dress code and other rules but in some special cases, say if the student is celebrating his/her birthday (until 8th class) they can wear any dress from home.

questions.question: Are smart devices allowed in the school?
questions.answer: No, smart devices are strictly prohibited in our school, even smartwatches are also not allowed.

questions.question: What is the exam schedule?
questions.answer: For the classes below 3rd there is no exam, just normal test, and for the classes above the exams are divided into four parts, 1st in July of 20 marks, 2nd in September of 80 marks, 3rd in January of 20marks, and the final paper in February of 80marks.

questions.question: How are assessments and grading conducted
questions.answer: the school uses a variety of assessment methods, including tests, projects, presentations, and class participation. Grading is usually based on a combination of these assessments, providing a well-rounded evaluation of a student's performance and progress.

questions.question: Does the school offer any specialized programs, such as gifted education or special needs support?
questions.answer: Yes, the school provides specialized programs to cater to the needs of both gifted students and those with special needs.
